thread.title: Tom Brady responsible for all but one yard of offense in win over Jets
thread.title_full: Tom Brady responsible for all but one yard of offense in win over Jets | Boston Herald

author: Chris Mason
title: Tom Brady responsible for all but one yard of offense in win over Jets
text:
Tom Brady responsible for all but one yard of offense in win over Jets Chris Mason New England Patriots quarterback Tom Brady, right, exchanges words with New York Jets defensive tackle Leger Douzable. comments Tweet In the Patriots 30-23 win over the Jets, Tom Brady's offense picked up 353 yards.
The quarterback was responsible for 352 of them.
Brady threw for 355 yards (but lost 18 yards on three sacks), for a net total of 337 passing yards.
For the first time in his 16-year career, Brady also led the Patriots in rushing. He tucked the ball and ran four times for a total of 15 yards.
James White carried the ball twice for four yards, and LeGarrette Blount ran three times for negative three yards.
That's a grand total of five carries for one yard from Patriots not named Brady.
According to Elias Sports Bureau, Brady made history with the frequency of his passing as well.
He threw the ball 54 times, and his passes made up for 86 percent of offensive plays.
That's the highest percentage of passing in NFL history for a team that won a football game.
Against the league's No. 1 defense, Brady was in total control of his offense.
